intro: Heteropterys pauciflora var. granatensis, commonly known as the Granatense Heteropterys, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
